response: In case of a fire, evacuate the building immediately and call emergency services at 101.
For a medical emergency, please contact emergency services at 108 and apply first aid if trained.
In case of a road accident, ensure safety first, call emergency services at 108, and provide first aid if trained.
During an earthquake, drop, cover, and hold on. After the tremors, evacuate the building and call for help if needed.
In case of a flood, move to higher ground and avoid walking or driving through floodwaters. Contact emergency services at 1077.
If there is a chemical spill, evacuate the area immediately and call emergency services at 101 for hazardous material assistance.
In case of a bomb threat, evacuate the area, do not touch any suspicious items, and call the police at 100.
In a hostage situation, remain calm, try to get to safety, and call emergency services at 100.
If you are in a shooting incident, find a safe place to hide and call emergency services at 100.
In case of a terrorist attack, find a safe location, evacuate if possible, and call emergency services at 100.
If you have lost a child, alert security personnel and contact local police at 100.
If someone is sick and needs immediate help, call emergency services at 108 and provide first aid if you are trained.
If you or someone you know is facing domestic violence, please contact the police at 100 or a local helpline.
If you or someone you know is having suicidal thoughts, please contact a mental health professional or a helpline immediately.
For any injury, apply first aid and call emergency services at 108 for further assistance.
In case of an animal attack, seek safety immediately and contact emergency services at 100.
If a building has collapsed, evacuate the area and call emergency services at 101 for rescue assistance.
In case of a gas leak, evacuate the area immediately, avoid using any electrical appliances, and call emergency services at 101.
If there is a road blockage, find an alternative route and inform local authorities by calling 100.
If you suspect child abuse, report it to local authorities or child protection services immediately.
If you are a victim of sexual assault, seek safety, contact the police at 100, and get medical help.
If someone is missing, report it to the police at 100 and provide them with all necessary information.
If there is a public disturbance, contact the police at 100 to report the situation.
If you or someone is in emotional distress, please reach out to a mental health professional or helpline.
During a natural disaster, stay informed through local news and follow emergency instructions.
If the fire alarm goes off, evacuate the building immediately and call emergency services at 101.
If you find yourself in an unsafe situation, seek help from nearby authorities and contact the police at 100.
If you see a suspicious package, do not touch it, evacuate the area, and call the police at 100.
In case of a traffic accident, ensure safety, call emergency services at 108, and provide first aid if needed.
If someone has overdosed, call emergency services at 108 and provide first aid if trained.
In case of a power outage, ensure safety and check for updates from local authorities.
During severe weather, stay indoors, monitor updates, and follow local emergency instructions.
In case of a bomb scare, evacuate the area immediately and contact the police at 100.
If you notice suspicious behavior, report it to local authorities by calling 100.
In case of a building fire, use the nearest exit to evacuate and call emergency services at 101.
If you require a helicopter rescue, call emergency services at 101 and provide your location.
For roadside assistance, contact a towing service or call local emergency services at 108.
In a community emergency, stay informed through local news and follow emergency guidelines.
If someone needs CPR, call emergency services at 108 immediately and start CPR if trained.
In case of heat stroke, move the person to a cooler place, hydrate them, and call emergency services at 108.
For hypothermia, warm the person gradually, provide dry clothing, and call emergency services at 108.
If someone is choking, perform the Heimlich maneuver and call emergency services at 108 if they can't breathe.
For an allergic reaction, administer an EpiPen if available, and call emergency services at 108.
If someone shows stroke symptoms, call emergency services at 108 immediately and note the time of symptoms.
